title: Improving Instructional Strategies Through Comparative Analysis of Feedforward Effects

context.prior_knowledge: Experience in instructional design and feedback provision, basic understanding of academic writing
context.additional_context: Smartphone-based learning environment, comparative experiment on feedback effectiveness during outlining/drafting stages of document writing

learning_goals: Learners can explain the difference in effectiveness between outline-stage and draft-stage feedforward with 80% or higher accuracy.
Learners can apply patterns of performance improvement based on feedforward types to actual instructional design cases.
Learners can propose three or more strategies for utilizing smartphone-based feedforward tools in constrained technological environments.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
